summaryText: Wow, what a powerful message from Pastor Travis Hearn about the incredible power of words! In this sermon from his 'Weapons' series, PT dives deep into how our words are spiritual weapons that can either build up or tear down. He reminds us that our mouths are not just instruments of communication, but powerful tools that can literally shape our lives and the lives of those around us. Pastor Travis breaks down how our words reveal our heart's condition, showing that what comes out of our mouth is a direct reflection of what's inside us. Can you imagine the responsibility we have with every single word we speak? The sermon challenges us to be intentional, thoughtful, and kind in our communication, emphasizing that our words can bring life or death. PT shares practical wisdom from Proverbs about being quick to listen, slow to speak, and using our words to encourage, support, and uplift others. The most striking point? Our words have eternal consequences - we will actually give an account for every idle word spoken! This isn't just about being nice; it's about reflecting God's character through our speech.
mainPoints: Words reveal the condition of our heart
Our words have the power to build up or destroy
We are responsible for managing the gift of our mouth

versesMentioned.text: The weapons we fight with are not the weapons of the world. On the contrary, they have divine power to demolish strongholds.
Be alert and of sober mind. Your enemy the devil prowls around like a roaring lion looking for someone to devour.
No weapon formed against you shall prosper.
The tongue has the power of life and death, and those who love it will eat its fruit.

With the tongue we praise our Lord and Father, and with it we curse human beings, who have been made in God's likeness. Out of the same mouth come praise and cursing. My brothers and sisters, this should not be.
A good man brings good things out of the good stored up in his heart, and an evil man brings evil things out of the evil stored up in his heart. For the mouth speaks what the heart is full of.
Above all else, guard your heart, for everything you do flows from it.
My dear brothers and sisters, take note of this: Everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak and slow to become angry.
A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.
So that you may become blameless and pure, 'children of God without fault in a warped and crooked generation.' Then you will shine among them like stars in the sky.
But now you must also rid yourselves of all such things as these: anger, rage, malicious behavior, slander, and filthy language from your lips.

Monday.scripture: Psalm 141:3: 'Set a guard over my mouth, Lord; keep watch over the door of my lips.'
Monday.focus: Becoming aware of the power of our words
Monday.action: Keep a journal of every word you speak today. At the end of the day, review your words and ask: 'Would these words bring life or death to someone?'
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me be mindful of my words today. Show me where I need to guard my mouth and speak with grace and love. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Proverbs 16:24: 'Gracious words are a honeycomb, sweet to the soul and healing to the bones.'
Tuesday.focus: Using words to heal and encourage
Tuesday.action: Intentionally give three specific compliments or words of encouragement to different people today. Make them genuine and meaningful.
Tuesday.prayer: God, help me be an instrument of Your encouragement. Let my words bring hope and healing to those around me. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Ephesians 4:29: 'Do not let any unwholesome talk come out of your mouths, but only what is helpful for building others up according to their needs, that it may benefit those who listen.'
Wednesday.action: Before speaking, pause and ask yourself: 'Will these words build up or tear down?' If they don't build up, choose not to speak.
Wednesday.prayer: Father, transform my communication. Help me speak words that reflect Your love and bring life to others. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Proverbs 12:18: 'The words of the reckless pierce like swords, but the tongue of the wise brings healing.'
Thursday.action: Practice active listening today. Focus on understanding others before formulating your response.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, give me wisdom to listen more and speak less. Help me be quick to listen and slow to speak. Amen.

Friday.scripture: James 3:5: 'Likewise, the tongue is a small part of the body, but it makes great boasts. Consider what a great forest is set on fire by a small spark.'
Friday.focus: Understanding the ripple effect of our words
Friday.action: Reflect on a time your words significantly impacted someone (positively or negatively). Journal about this experience and what you learned.
Friday.prayer: God, make me aware of the power of my words. Help me use them to spread Your love and light. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Colossians 4:6: 'Let your conversation be always full of grace, seasoned with salt, so that you may know how to answer everyone.'
Saturday.action: Practice responding to potential conflicts with grace. If someone tries to provoke you, respond with kindness and understanding.
Saturday.prayer: Holy Spirit, fill me with Your grace. Help me respond to others with the same love and patience You show me. Amen.
